title.narrative: Natural Resource Governance Institute (NRGI): Strengthening Civil Society and Increasing Tax Revenues and Transparency (teema 2)

description.narrative: NRGI:n hanke Strengthening Civil Society and Increasing Tax Revenues and Transparency on linjassa järjestön strategisten tavoitteiden kanssa. Hankkeen kaksi outcome-tason tavoitetta tukevat toisiaan toisaalta julkisen sektorin tehostamisen ja toisaalta k ansalaisyhteiskunnan vahvistamisen näkökulmista:?Tehokkaampi ja tilivelvollinen julkinen sektori jolla on läpinäkyvä ja epätasa-arvoa kitkevä verojärjestelmä;?Kansalaisyhteiskunnan mahdollistava toimintaympäristö ja kapasiteetti vaikuttaa ja osa llistua päätöksentekoon on parantunut.

The project aims to contribute to citizens of DRC Ghana Guinea Senegal Tanzania and Uganda having increased benefits and reduced harms from their natural resources. By increasing sustainable and well-managed tax revenues from the extractives sector the pro ject will ensure more funds reach national budgets to be used for public services social spending and national investment helping to drive economic growth and lift citizens out of poverty. The project is designed to reduce harms which are linked to the ext ractive sector both in terms of direct impacts such as conflict and social and environmental effects as well as growing inequality and gender-differentiated impacts. The expected long-term changes to be achieved by the proposed project will be improved res ource governance practice and norms accompanied by improved implementation of those changes and strengthened civil society organizations empowered to demand evidence-based policy reforms and hold duty bearers in the extractives sector to account.The specif ic results we aim to achieve are:Impact: Countries rich in oil gas and minerals achieve sustainable inclusive development and people receive lasting benefits from extractives and experience reduced harms.- Outcome 1 - A more effective and accountable publi c sector with transparent and inequality reducing tax system.o Output 1.1 Improved public sector management including decentralization and public financial management.o Output 1.2. More efficient and equitable taxation and other domestic resource mobilizat ion.- Outcome 2 - Enabling environment for and capacity of civil society to influence and participate in decision-making has improved.o Output 2.1 increased capacity of an independent vibrant and pluralistic civil society to organize advocate and participa te in policy-making.Across resource-rich countries in sub-Saharan Africa there has been a history of poor extractive industry revenue management. With the global climate crisis and an increased focus on energy transition and sourcing critical minerals stro ng civil society organizations have a crucial role to play in holding duty bearers to account for increasing tax revenues and equitable revenue management.
